Cherie Julianne Tan, Content Strategist at SeedlyLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 30 Mar 2019If your trip isn’t confirm, I wouldn’t get a travel insurance especially if it doesn’t have a 100% refund policy. Travel insurance usually have discounts almost all year round, so you would not be missing out on much! I would rather lose that 20% discount than my entire insurance premium if my trip isn’t confirmed. Though I do believe there are some insurance in the market that allows you to change the dates of coverage, do check with your trusted financial advisor on that! Hope this helps! :)0 comments1
